title: The Red-Hot Paradise Valley Market Just Delivered a Record-Breaking Sale
sub_head: The roughly 13,000-square-foot, Mediterranean-style house sold for $21 million
body:
A home in Paradise Valley, Ariz., has sold for $21 million, setting a record for the affluent town, according to the local multiple listing service.
The roughly 4.3-acre property first hit the market for $22.5 million last spring with Walt Danley and Catherine Jacobson of Walt Danley Christieâ€™s International Real Estate.
